biotools.summary: Automated tool for antimicrobial resistance surveillance system (AMASS) was developed as an offline, open-access and easy-to-use application that allows a hospital to perform data analysis independently and generate isolate-based and sample-based surveillance reports stratified by infection origin from routinely collected electronic databases. The application was built in R, which is a free software environment.
